intro: Hieracium korshinskyi, commonly known as the Korshinsky's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture and a serrated margin, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Hieracium korshinskyi is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
